title: Burkina Faso's President Steps Down After 27 Years
teaser: President Blaise Compaor√© succumbed to pressure after growing protests in the streets of the capital. The military has taken control of the country, which is one of America's strongest allies in west Africa. Audie Cornish talks with Pierre Englebert, professor of African politics at Pomona College.
